# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the Julia function which solves your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function uses the `map` function to apply a transformation to each element in the DateTime column `dt`. The transformation is defined by the anonymous function `(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"))`, which extracts the year and month from each date and formats them into the desired integer format. 

For example:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

df = DataFrame(dt = DateTime[now() - Month(i) for i in 1:5])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame. The first row of this column will be the year and month number of the fifth date from now, and so on.
